FILE: cm265385v11.0.txt
DYAD: E. GERMAN - NORWAY
RIVALRY: RIV741
DISPUTE(S): MID2939 

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20180209 
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20180209

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

MID2939 

TERRMID: MID2939 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2939 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2939 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2939 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2939 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2939 3 -- uncertain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2939 from Gibler, Miller, and Little (2016), Norway seized trawlers from Russia, Denmark, and GDR when they strayed into Norwegian waters. Coded not maritime because no boundary was being disputed, and coded uncertain because GML recommend this case be dropped since no protest occurred. 

ISLMID: MID2939 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2939 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2939 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2939 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2939 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2939 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2939 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2939 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2939 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2939 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

RIVNOTES: 

NARRATIVE-CM:

SOURCES-CM:

NARRATIVE-CR:

SOURCES-CR:

SOURCES: Gibler, D. M., S. V. Miller, and E. K. Little. 2016. "An Analysis of the Militarized Interstate Dispute (MID) Dataset, 1816-2001." International Studies Quarterly. 60 (4): 719-730.
